thread.title: Thurman-Porter could land in S.A.
thread.title_full: Thurman-Porter could land in S.A. - San Antonio Express-News

author: John Whisler
title: Thurman-Porter could land in S.A.
text:
Photo: Eric Jamison /Associated Press Image 1 of / 3 3 Keith Thurman connects with a right to Robert Guerrero during their boxing match, Saturday, March 7, 2015, in Las Vegas. Thurman won by unanimous decison.
Photo: Eric Jamison /Associated Press Keith Thurman connects with a right to Robert Guerrero during their... Image 2 of 3 Keith Thurman reacts after his WBA Interim Welterweight fight with Jesus Soto Karass part of the “Danger Zone” boxing card Saturday Dec. 14, 2013 at the Alamodome.
Photo: Edward A. Ornelas /San Antonio Express-News Keith Thurman reacts after his WBA Interim Welterweight fight with... Image 3 of 3 Professional boxer Shawn Porter attends the ‘High Stakes: Mayweather v. Berto’ fight presented by Showtime at the MGM Grand Garden Arena on September 12, 2015 in Las Vegas.
Photo: Bryan Steffy /Getty Images Professional boxer Shawn Porter attends the ‘High Stakes:... Thurman-Porter could land in S.A. 1 / 3 Back to Gallery Leija/Battah Promotions’ next scheduled fight card in San Antonio is set for Dec. 12, and it could be a blockbuster.
Reports say a fight featuring WBA welterweight champion Keith Thurman (26-0, 22 KOs) against former champion Shawn Porter 26-1-1, 16 KOs) is close to being finalized for either Las Vegas or San Antonio.
“We’re hoping to bring it here,” “Jesse” James Leija said.
Other Leija/Battah boxing cards are scheduled for Oct. 31 in Houston and Nov. 10 in Austin.
Boxing at the Wolff: AAA Promotions and TMB Entertainment are co-promoting a Nov. 14 pro boxing card at Wolff Stadium.
Joseph Rios (13-13-2, 4 KOs) is scheduled to take on Felipe Castaneda (9-5-1, 4 KOs) in the main event in a battle of San Antonians.
Other local fighters on the card include Kendo Castaneda , Joseph Zambrano , Robert Ledesma , Jerome Aiken , Tyrrel Herndon (pro debut), Javier Castaneda , Daniel Baiz and Dustin Southichack.
Tickets are $600 and $500 for VIP tables and $25 general admission.
Amateur card: The Advocates Boxing Club is hosting an amateur show Saturday at Bill Greehey Pavillion, 1600 Buena Vista.
Twenty bouts are scheduled featuring boxers from Dallas, Houston, Austin, Floresville and San Antonio. First bell is 2 p.m.
Tickets are $5 for general admission. Children 8 and under are free.
